1.2 Project Approach

When joining this project, I organized the project based on the following approach, analyzing the current situation the project faces and identifying breakthrough points for project design.

1.3 User Research & User Stories

Based on the above situation, I conducted a coarse-grained research on the current usage of existing IM tools and user feedback based on the IM suite in existing applications. I gained insights into presentation-level issues such as text and image layout problems, as well as framework experience-level issues. In the MVP stage, I focused only on framework experience-level issues to identify breakthrough points for product design.

1.4 IM Consumption & AI-Enabled Product Architecture · Design Opportunities Summary

Combining the top-level unique organizational collaboration concept and the office experience we want to bring to Xiaohongshu employees, I identified the following product design opportunities:

1.4.1 Opportunity 1: Enable REDers to work autonomously, increasing FocusTime to 2 hours per person
1.4.2 Opportunity 2: Shorten interaction paths, multithread task processing, create immersive focused office experience
1.4.3 Opportunity 3: Context not Control: Complete context, intelligent Agent empowers REDers to work smartly
02
2. Deconstructing Opportunity 1: IM Noise Reduction
IM Noise Reduction
2.1 Competitive Analysis

I analyzed how competitors approach noise reduction design, examining their noise reduction concepts and analyzing the weight of product noise reduction through product design paths. Based on the asynchronous collaboration concept, I also selected email products that lean towards asynchronous collaboration in the design. I analyzed how such products categorize information to help users focus and improve their ability to accurately process messages within unit time.

Throughout the process, I repeatedly applied design trade-off principles, analyzing all functional points and experience path solutions of competitors, using the minimum interactive design functions to combine the best noise reduction experience path for users to achieve maximum user experience.

2.2 Design Solutions

Based on the results of competitive research, user feedback on IM single-point functions, and the new organizational collaboration concept, I proposed design solution presets.

2.3 Low-Fidelity Prototypes

Based on the above design solutions, I derived 3 IM consumption and noise reduction experience path prototypes. All 3 solutions are based on established distinctions: important vs unimportant, temporary urgent conversation scenarios, left-side Filter message classification manager, and scheduled cleanup concepts for conceptual design. The goal is to find ways to distinguish read vs unread messages and create cleaner Feed consumption paths to protect users' mental state.

2.4 UAT Testing

I simultaneously distributed UAT tests to user groups to collect user feedback.

2.4 User Flow Planning

Core architecture page mental flow planning validation.

2.5 Solution Confirmation & Key Pages

Complete solution presentation (creating IM's a-ha Moment)

2.6 Demo: Complete Solution Demo

Based on user feedback, I adjusted the design solution and finally completed the optimal IM consumption path. I achieved the following MVP IM product solution design.

3. Deconstructing Opportunity 2: Multithreading Task Solution
Multithreading Tasks
3.1 Research & Exploration

In terms of IM consumption paths, we conducted extensive research and validation. Additionally, in terms of design opportunities, we also conducted extensive desktop research and competitive analysis. After conducting research, we preset two design solutions. From the current product form and better user experience perspective, preset solution 1 and preset solution 2 both have very obvious advantages and disadvantages in terms of All-in-one experience and existing products, requiring more user data validation. Additionally, from an experience perspective, solution 1 would feel more lightweight.

4. Deconstructing Opportunity 3: AI Experience
AI Experience
4.1 AI Experience Development

From the Shuming Xiaodigua project, connecting to the knowledge base, I implemented a dual-platform AI conversation framework, while benchmarking against the main site's AI Da Vinci conversation experience, creating a seamless enterprise efficiency AI conversation experience.

4.3 IM/AI Component Specification Abstraction

I implemented AI conversation scenarios and AI conversation experience framework components for various states, including: bubble messages, cards, references, exception handling, conversation interruption modes, stop generation, and other important AI conversation components and container rules. As business expands, more experience measurement models and optimization standards will be introduced in the future.

4.4 Emotional Design

At the same time, in the design of enterprise efficiency products, I also pay more attention to emotional interaction design. Not just tools. In Red city, I focus on human feeling and community feeling. In existing product design single points, I also emphasize interactivity very much.

5.4 Color System Optimization

Regarding project knowledge accumulation, I have created my site for knowledge sharing, which you can click to visit. My Insight

During the project implementation process, I also discovered issues with insufficient color usability in existing color systems. I specifically executed color optimization. On one hand, I made colors more gentle, using HCT color space to unify frontend color brightness. On the other hand, I optimized color usability and generated corresponding dual-color Design Tokens.
